title: R4Eco: Data management and analysis in environmental sciences
text:
Example Dataset ‘mpg’: fuel economy data of cars
how does the data look like?










head(mpg)

# A tibble: 6 × 11
  manufacturer model displ  year   cyl trans      drv     cty   hwy fl    class 
  <chr>        <chr> <dbl> <int> <int> <chr>      <chr> <int> <int> <chr> <chr> 
1 audi         a4      1.8  1999     4 auto(l5)   f        18    29 p     compa…
2 audi         a4      1.8  1999     4 manual(m5) f        21    29 p     compa…
3 audi         a4      2    2008     4 manual(m6) f        20    31 p     compa…
4 audi         a4      2    2008     4 auto(av)   f        21    30 p     compa…
5 audi         a4      2.8  1999     6 auto(l5)   f        16    26 p     compa…
6 audi         a4      2.8  1999     6 manual(m5) f        18    26 p     compa…


displ: engine displacement in litres
hwy: highway efficiency (miles per gallon)



Also useful

summary(mpg)


glimpse(mpg)


view(mpg)


dim(mpg)




Different options to create plots in R

base R: ok, but sometimes well annoying
plotly
ggplot2: versatile. elegant. consistent. fun. wohooo!




The grammar of graphics.









mpg %>% 
  ggplot()







displ: engine volume hwy: fuel efficiency (miles per gallon)

mpg %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = displ, y = hwy))







-> adding layers

mpg %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + 
  geom_point()








mpg %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = manufacturer)) + 
  geom_point()








mpg %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = manufacturer)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  labs(title = "Large displacement lowers fuel efficiency", 
       x = "Displacement", y = "Efficiency", 
       caption = "mgp data")








p <- mpg %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = manufacturer)) + 
  geom_point() 
ggsave("displ_vs_hwy.png", plot = p)



free choice of data format (.pdf, .png)
numerous options to change size, scaling etc., see ?ggsave
saves directly into working directory, unless specified differently (e.g. in subfolder)





Exercise Part 1.
pdf sheet on OLAT




ggplot(data = <DATA>) + 
  <GEOM_FUNCTION>(aes(<MAPPINGS>))

to make a graph, we replace the bracketed sections with

a dataset
a geom function
a collection of mappings/aestethics





color
fill
shape
linetype
size
alpha









Example: color and shape


ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = displ, y = hwy, 
                           color = drv))



ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = displ, y = hwy, 
             shape = drv))








automatic vs. manual setting of mappings


ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = displ, y = hwy, 
                           color = drv))



ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = displ, y = hwy), 
             color = "red")








geom_point(), geom_line(), geom_smooth(), … and tons of others!


ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = displ, y = hwy))



ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_smooth(aes(x = displ, y = hwy))









ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = drv)) +
  geom_smooth(aes(x = displ, y = hwy))

`geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula 'y ~ x'









ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) +
  geom_smooth(aes(x = displ, y = hwy))


ggplot(data = mpg, 
       aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth()






ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = displ, y = hwy, 
                 color = drv)) +
  geom_smooth(aes(x = displ, y = hwy))



ggplot(data = mpg, 
       aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = drv)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth()






How can we fix it?






ggplot(data = mpg, 
       aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = drv)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth()



ggplot(data = mpg, 
       aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + 
  geom_point(aes(color = drv)) + 
  geom_smooth()








Different ways to achieve the same.


ggplot(data = mpg, 
       aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + 
  geom_point(aes(color = drv)) + 
  geom_smooth()



ggplot(data = mpg, 
       aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = drv)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(aes(group = 1))









head(mpg)

# A tibble: 6 × 11
  manufacturer model displ  year   cyl trans      drv     cty   hwy fl    class 
  <chr>        <chr> <dbl> <int> <int> <chr>      <chr> <int> <int> <chr> <chr> 
1 audi         a4      1.8  1999     4 auto(l5)   f        18    29 p     compa…
2 audi         a4      1.8  1999     4 manual(m5) f        21    29 p     compa…
3 audi         a4      2    2008     4 manual(m6) f        20    31 p     compa…
4 audi         a4      2    2008     4 auto(av)   f        21    30 p     compa…
5 audi         a4      2.8  1999     6 auto(l5)   f        16    26 p     compa…
6 audi         a4      2.8  1999     6 manual(m5) f        18    26 p     compa…







ggplot(data = mpg, 
       aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + 
  geom_point(aes(color = drv)) 



ggplot(data = mpg, 
       aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = cty)) + 
  geom_point() 









geom_smooth
geom_bar
geom_boxplot
geom_density
geom_violine





ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_bar(aes(x = class))




Count does not show up in the original data!
-> calculated by algorithm, the so-called stat








Different geom have different default stat.
check ?geom_bar for details to each geom.




We can override the default stat.
Example: proportion instead of absolute count
look up the ‘computed variables’ in the help section


ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_bar(aes(x = class, y = ..prop.., group = 1))









ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_boxplot(aes(x = class, y = hwy, 
                   fill = class))



ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_violin(aes(x = class, y = hwy, 
                  fill = class))









ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_density(aes(x = hwy, fill = drv), alpha = 0.5)







facet_wrap

ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(mapping = aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + 
  facet_wrap(~ class, nrow = 2)







facet_grid

ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(mapping = aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + 
  facet_grid(drv ~ cyl)




Variables for facet_wrap and facet_grid should be discrete!



Many ways to customize your figures


change general appearance: themes
change color, linetypes, shapes, etc.: scales
adjust axis labels, …
…





https://rstudio.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/ggplot2-cheatsheet.pdf








Hands on

http://www.cookbook-r.com/Graphs/
https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/
Stackoverflow
Twitter: #rstats
https://www.springer.com/de/book/9783319242750: great book, but not for free :(

Theory
H. Wickham (2010): A layered grammar of graphics. Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics, 19(1), pp 3-28.
https://vita.had.co.nz/papers/layered-grammar.html
Claus Wilke: Fundamentals of Data Visualization
https://clauswilke.com/dataviz/

title: R4Eco: Data management and analysis in environmental sciences
text:
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See @knuth84 for additional discussion of literate programming.


Learn the tools and skills to


organise your data & code consistently




win the everyday data wrangling




make quick (and cool) visualizations




keep your project reproducible




present and communicate your results




be able to do your own troubleshooting








Data Science Workflow







Basic functionality of R & RStudio
Data Visualization using ggplot2
Data Wrangling
The concept of ‘tidy data’
Reproducible Research: R markdown
Advanced R: Loops
Advanced R: Functions
Data management, storage, and structure
Useful stuff along the way, e.g. handling dates & times














Date
Held by
Topic




2022-11-22
Johnny
Basics in R, R-projects, Visualization


2022-11-25
Johnny
Data wrangling, Data formats


2022-12-06
Jesse
Tidy data, dates & times


2022-12-13
Jesse
Advanced Visualization, R markdown, useful stuff along the way


2022-01-10
Jesse
Loops, Base-R


2023-01-17
Jesse
Functions


2023-01-24
Jesse
Data management, storage and structure


2023-01-31
Jesse
Open issues & questions









Weekly sessions: combined lecture & excercise: Interactive!
A task will be set at the end of each session
Due dates will be given, typically latest 2.5 weeks after each session







All tasks must be completed and passed to pass the course
Tasks will be submitted on OLAT
No exam, no other reports
Tasks are graded, overall grade will be averaged
The tasks are designed to help you learn the material
Material is developed progressively through the course, so whenever possible it is strongly recommended to complete tasks before the next lecture







Who are you?
What is your PhD project about?
Any experience with R so far?







Getting to know R & RStudio
Data Visualization with ggplot2
Exercise
Assignment





Updated versions of:

R: https://cloud.r-project.org
RStudio: http://www.rstudio.com/download







R Studio working environment







your whole data science project within one folder
R-Studio project
working directory
Rscripts: store with meaningful names
use relative paths instead of absolute




Everything in one place
Allows moving between computers






create a project for this course
create an R-script
write code in script and send to console
comment script using ‘#’





add-ons
increase functionality of R

Important:

tidyverse
readxl

Can be installed via

install.packages("tidyverse")

and loaded via

library(tidyverse)

Task: install tidyverse



Tidyverse is a suite of packages that use a consistent language of code.

# Base R
time.as.string = paste(CO2_ML$year,CO2_ML$month,CO2_ML$day,sep="-")
CO2_ML$dt = as.POSIXct(strptime(time.as.string,"%Y-%m-%d"), tz = "GMT") # convert time to an R time stamp
CO2_ML[CO2_ML==-999.999] = NA 


# tidyverse
CO2_ML %>% 
  mutate(time.as.string = paste(year, month, day, sep = "-"), # create timestamp
         dt = ymd(time.as.string, tz = "GMT"), # convert to time
         CO2_ML = ifelse(CO2_ML == -999.999, NA, CO2_ML))  



complements and supplements base-R code
does not replace base-R
increases efficiency
tons of useful functions




easier to write
easier to read






https://r4ds.had.co.nz/
www.r-bloggers.com
Google (or alternatives): “R”
stackoverflow

title: R4Eco: Data management and analysis in environmental sciences
text:
Preface
Welcome to the course website of “Data management and analysis in environmental sciences”.
This site contain slides and additional study material provided by Johannes Ingrisch, University of Innsbruck.

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Data Exploration

Example Dataset ‘mpg’: fuel economy data of cars
how does the data look like?

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
mpg dataset

head(mpg)

# A tibble: 6 × 11
  manufacturer model displ  year   cyl trans      drv     cty   hwy fl    class 
  <chr>        <chr> <dbl> <int> <int> <chr>      <chr> <int> <int> <chr> <chr> 
1 audi         a4      1.8  1999     4 auto(l5)   f        18    29 p     compa…
2 audi         a4      1.8  1999     4 manual(m5) f        21    29 p     compa…
3 audi         a4      2    2008     4 manual(m6) f        20    31 p     compa…
4 audi         a4      2    2008     4 auto(av)   f        21    30 p     compa…
5 audi         a4      2.8  1999     6 auto(l5)   f        16    26 p     compa…
6 audi         a4      2.8  1999     6 manual(m5) f        18    26 p     compa…


displ: engine displacement in litres
hwy: highway efficiency (miles per gallon)

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
mpg dataset
Also useful

summary(mpg)


glimpse(mpg)


view(mpg)


dim(mpg)

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Data Visualization
Different options to create plots in R

base R: ok, but sometimes well annoying
plotly
ggplot2: versatile. elegant. consistent. fun. wohooo!

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Data Visualization in ggplot2
The grammar of graphics.

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Visualization: Canvas

mpg %>% 
  ggplot()

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Visualization: Axes
displ: engine volume hwy: fuel efficiency (miles per gallon)

mpg %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = displ, y = hwy))

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Visualization: Data
-> adding layers

mpg %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + 
  geom_point()

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Visualization: Color Coding

mpg %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = manufacturer)) + 
  geom_point()

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Visualization: Labels

mpg %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = manufacturer)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  labs(title = "Large displacement lowers fuel efficiency", 
       x = "Displacement", y = "Efficiency", 
       caption = "mgp data")

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Visualization: save plot

p <- mpg %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = manufacturer)) + 
  geom_point() 
ggsave("displ_vs_hwy.png", plot = p)



free choice of data format (.pdf, .png)
numerous options to change size, scaling etc., see ?ggsave
saves directly into working directory, unless specified differently (e.g. in subfolder)

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Time to check it out..
Exercise Part 1.
pdf sheet on OLAT

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
ggplot: General template

ggplot(data = <DATA>) + 
  <GEOM_FUNCTION>(aes(<MAPPINGS>))

to make a graph, we replace the bracketed sections with

a dataset
a geom function
a collection of mappings/aestethics

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
mappings/aestethics

color
fill
shape
linetype
size
alpha

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
mappings/aestethics
Example: color and shape


ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = displ, y = hwy, 
                           color = drv))



ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = displ, y = hwy, 
             shape = drv))

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
mappings/aestethics
automatic vs. manual setting of mappings


ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = displ, y = hwy, 
                           color = drv))



ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = displ, y = hwy), 
             color = "red")

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
geoms
geom_point(), geom_line(), geom_smooth(), … and tons of others!


ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = displ, y = hwy))



ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_smooth(aes(x = displ, y = hwy))

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Combine it!

ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = drv)) +
  geom_smooth(aes(x = displ, y = hwy))

`geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula 'y ~ x'

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Avoid Code Duplication

ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) +
  geom_smooth(aes(x = displ, y = hwy))


ggplot(data = mpg, 
       aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth()

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Note the difference!


ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = displ, y = hwy, 
                 color = drv)) +
  geom_smooth(aes(x = displ, y = hwy))



ggplot(data = mpg, 
       aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = drv)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth()






How can we fix it?

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
section: Solution: Individual aes() for different geoms
text:
Solution: Individual aes() for different geoms


ggplot(data = mpg, 
       aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = drv)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth()



ggplot(data = mpg, 
       aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + 
  geom_point(aes(color = drv)) + 
  geom_smooth()

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Individual aes() for different geoms
Different ways to achieve the same.


ggplot(data = mpg, 
       aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + 
  geom_point(aes(color = drv)) + 
  geom_smooth()



ggplot(data = mpg, 
       aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = drv)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(aes(group = 1))

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Discrete vs. continuous variables

head(mpg)

# A tibble: 6 × 11
  manufacturer model displ  year   cyl trans      drv     cty   hwy fl    class 
  <chr>        <chr> <dbl> <int> <int> <chr>      <chr> <int> <int> <chr> <chr> 
1 audi         a4      1.8  1999     4 auto(l5)   f        18    29 p     compa…
2 audi         a4      1.8  1999     4 manual(m5) f        21    29 p     compa…
3 audi         a4      2    2008     4 manual(m6) f        20    31 p     compa…
4 audi         a4      2    2008     4 auto(av)   f        21    30 p     compa…
5 audi         a4      2.8  1999     6 auto(l5)   f        16    26 p     compa…
6 audi         a4      2.8  1999     6 manual(m5) f        18    26 p     compa…

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Discrete vs. continuous variables


ggplot(data = mpg, 
       aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + 
  geom_point(aes(color = drv)) 



ggplot(data = mpg, 
       aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = cty)) + 
  geom_point()

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Geoms with statistical transformation

geom_smooth
geom_bar
geom_boxplot
geom_density
geom_violine

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Example: geom_bar

ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_bar(aes(x = class))




Count does not show up in the original data!
-> calculated by algorithm, the so-called stat

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Example: geom_bar





Different geom have different default stat.
check ?geom_bar for details to each geom.

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Example: geom_bar

We can override the default stat.
Example: proportion instead of absolute count
look up the ‘computed variables’ in the help section


ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_bar(aes(x = class, y = ..prop.., group = 1))

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Boxplots & Violin-Plots


ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_boxplot(aes(x = class, y = hwy, 
                   fill = class))



ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_violin(aes(x = class, y = hwy, 
                  fill = class))

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Visualize distributions

ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_density(aes(x = hwy, fill = drv), alpha = 0.5)

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
facets
facet_wrap

ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(mapping = aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + 
  facet_wrap(~ class, nrow = 2)

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
facets
facet_grid

ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(mapping = aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + 
  facet_grid(drv ~ cyl)




Variables for facet_wrap and facet_grid should be discrete!

title: Data management and analysis for environmental sciences
text:
Unhappy how it looks?
Many ways to customize your figures


change general appearance: themes
change color, linetypes, shapes, etc.: scales
adjust axis labels, …
…
